info.name: DSD APIs
info.description:
In-order to create a "BasicSolution" we shall 1st login into the Tenant.

 

For Login, we have to use a Token API where generates a access token for the authorization,then we shall provide the valid username and password to login which has been done in "Token Generation".

 

Create GSI
--
 For creating a solution we need to take a "gsi" call from the network tab(Developer Tools)and add URL,required headers,body and Tests.

 

Create  first CU
--
Then,we shall create our 1st changeunit for which we need to take a "change-unit" call from the network tab(Developer Tools) and add URL,required headers,body and Tests.

 

Create  first Entity
--
Now,for creating an entity in the changeunit, we need to take a entity call from the network tab(Developer Tools)which will appear once we create an entity on the web and add URL,required headers,body and Tests in it.

 

Add Entity To  first Cu
--
 Once we create an entity on the web and click on save, we get a "change-unit" call in the network tab(Developer Tools) which is used in order to add the entity to the changeunit.


Create Second Cu
--
 Then,we shall create our 2nd changeunit for which we need to take a "change-unit" call from the network tab(Developer Tools) and add URL,required headers,body and Tests.

 

Create Second Entity
--
Now,for creating an entity in the changeunit, we need to take a entity call from the network tab(Developer Tools)which will appear once we create an entity on the web and add URL,required headers,body and Tests in it.

 

Add Entity To Second Cu
--
 Once we create an entity on the web and click on save, we get a "change-unit" call in the network tab(Developer Tools) which is used in order to add the entity to the changeunit.

 

Add Cus To GSI 
--
After saving the 2nd  changeunit on web,we will get a call saying "gsi".

 

Finish GSI 
--
 After finishing the solution on web, use a "gsi" call and create a POST API.

 

Send Notification To Reviewer
--
 After sending an solution for the review,a "send" call will appear, use that and create a POST API for sending a notification.

 

Logout
--
 Now,for logout use the "Logout" API call generated in the network tab(Developer Tools).

 

Login As Reviewer
--
 Use the "Token" API call generated in the network tab(Developer Tools) for login.

 

Approve the GSI
--
for Approval of the solution, use the "SolutionId" API call generated in the network tab(Developer Tools).

 

Logout
--
 Now,for logout use the "Logout" API call generated in the network tab(Developer 
 Tools).

 

Login as Solution Designer
--
 Use the "Token" API call generated in the network tab(Developer Tools) for login.

 

Get Solution Details 
--
 Take the "gsi" call appeared after you search the solution on web.

 

Publish the GSI
--
 For publishing a solution use the "gsi" API call generated in the network tab(Developer Tools).

 

Start Execution
--
 Use the very 1st generated change-unit call while you do the execution.

 

Execute First Cu
--
 Use the change-unit call, which will be generated when you execute the 1st Cu.

 

Execute Second Cu
--
 Use the change-unit call, which will be generated when you execute the 2nd Cu.

header.value: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/86.0.4240.198 Safari/537.36

exec: pm.test("Verify basic solution is published successfully", function(){
pm.expect(pm.response.json().message).to.eq("GSI "+pm.variables.get('SolutionName')+" GSI Unit Id :"+pm.variables.get('SolutionId')+" is successfully published");
